attributes.action: Allow the registration of 15 year olds, enabling them eligibility to vote at 16
attributes.background: Young people should be allowed to vote in all local and national elections and referendums. During the recent European referendum, an increasing amount of younger people were voicing frustration at not being allowed to take part in the democratic process.
attributes.additional_details: Younger people are becoming increasingly interested in politics at a local, national and global level. It seems unfair that people under 18 should be excluded from a process that has implications on their lives and shapes their long term future. I am calling on the UK parliament to extend the right to vote to all 16 year olds. While recently campaigning, talking to young people indicated to me that they are showing a real enthusiasm and interest in how politics affects their lives.

attributes.action: Delay the replacement of Trident till after the imminent Scottish referendum
attributes.background: We've all debated the strong moral and ethical case for the replacement of Britain's nuclear 'deterrent' program. However, following the UK's decision to exit the European Union on the June 23rd this year. There is now a stronger economical and political case to be made against its renewal.
attributes.additional_details: Following the UK's exit from the European Union and the massive decline in the value of the £, the cost of replacing Trident is expected to rise significantly from the Department of Defence's previous estimate of around £40 billion to £60-150 billion. Furthermore, Scotland's potential exit from the union means the current base of the nuclear 'deterrent' in Clyde may no longer be tenable. It is not right that we replace our nuclear weapons for status, a serious debate on this issue is required.

attributes.action: Give UK citizenship automatically to foreign parents of British children
attributes.background:
I am Hungarian, business owner, property owner, a UK resident, have 2 British children, born in the UK.
I want the government to give me and other parents a guarantee, that after leaving the EU, I will have the right to remain, with my family by giving citizenship to parents like me, automatically.

attributes.action: Overhaul The New GCSE's Making Them Easier For Students Sitting Them In 2017
attributes.background: The New GCSE's Have been declared 'too hard' by the exams regulator. Students will be sitting them around June 2017 and so far Mocks and Practice papers have shown the pass rate to be low! Others have quoted that a mark lower than 50% would be required to achieve an A Grade! They are just too hard.
attributes.additional_details:
We Want The Goverment To Consider changing the Maths exams for 2017 making them less challenging for students, many experts have agreed they are simply to hard! 
Please read  the following BBC Article http://goo.gl/FCxYI7 The changes brought in my Michael Gove were exceptionally radical and don't allow children to achieve their fullest potential, Sign the petition to make the new GCSEs fairer for our kids and the leaders of the future.

attributes.action: A new ONS prevalence survey into Children's and Young People's Mental Health.
attributes.background: Office of National Statistics prevalence surveys were carried out into Children and Young People's Mental Health in 1999 & 2004.  We have no equivalent up to date information.  There are indicators of a growing problem in the UK in this area.  A new survey would highlight the need for action.
attributes.additional_details:
House of Commons Health Committee, "Children's and Adolescent's mental health and CAMHS: Third Report of Session 2014-15", p17, http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201415/cmselect/cmhealth/342/342.pdf
Chief Medical Officer, "Annual Report 2012: Our Children Deserve Better", ch10 p3, https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/255237/2901304_CMO_complete_low_res_accessible.pdf

attributes.action: Have a serious debate regarding Capital Punishment for murder
attributes.background: This is not a knee jerk reaction to the appalling events in Birstall yesterday but more a reaction to the ease with taking a life has become acceptable, Capital Punishment would hopefully make some people think twice before ending a person's life.
attributes.additional_details: The progress with DNA testing must make it unlikely any one innocent of a crime would be punished in erroras,  I know happened in the past.

attributes.action: Ban teaching children under 16 religion
attributes.background: Leaders of religious and faith based groups raise money from supporters on an unproven pretext. In any sphere of life this amounts to fraud.
attributes.additional_details: No faith based teaching should be allowed to be given to children under the age of 16. The concept of a external superior force or being is so incredible that children need early indoctrination for the idea to take hold. It is unlikely that given free will an individual would arrive at the idea that our actions our guided by an unearthly force.

attributes.action: Make schools have Meatless Mondays in order to reduce pollution.
attributes.background: I believe all UK schools should introduce Meatless Mondays in order to reduce the pollution caused by the meat trade and for students to help reduce pollution in a way that also promotes kindness, compassion and respect for other life.

attributes.action: Receiving Carers Allowance should not affect other benefits or taxes
attributes.background: People who receive Carers Allowance should not have to pay extra tax or have their other benefits cut. People receiving a state pension must also be able to claim Carers Allowance while looking after a loved one. Mandy Bayliffe tried to change things in her short life so now we must.
attributes.additional_details: Carers Allowance should be tax-free, like PIP, and shouldn’t affect any other benefits that carers may receive. I am 67 years old, in receipt of a State Pension, which I paid for through 40 years of work. Yet I cannot claim Carers Allowance because the Government does not allow you to claim both. This means men and women who can claim their State Pensions are excluded. These same people are more often than not by their loved ones sides 24/7 yet receive no recompense for it either.

attributes.action: Stop councils forcing homeless tenants to stay past a section 21
attributes.background:
Local housing authorities are forcing private tenants to stay after the end date of a section 21, and making them wait until bailiff evictions. The tenant is responsible for the court and bailiff costs.
If the tenant does not stay, they are deemed intentionally homeless and refused help.
attributes.additional_details: Both local councils and shelter England advice the tenant to stay after the end of the section 21 date. Why should the tenant be liable for cost when following the councils guidance? Why should landlords have to take tenants to court to get their properties back.? Why are councils using a form of blackmail to get tenants to do what they want?

attributes.action: Reduce planning restrictions when converting derelict land into amenity space
attributes.background: I am 77 year old passionate gardener trying to rescue derelict land.  It had lots of non-native invasive weeds. I have transformed the space into a haven for wildlife. Salford council have taken over a year to grant permission, costing me 6k on surveys and fees. This should be quicker and cheaper.
attributes.additional_details:
Japanese Knotweed and Himalayan Balsam, invasive weeds:
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/prevent-the-spread-of-harmful-invasive-and-non-native-plants

Before and after pictures of the derelict land in question:
https://thesecretvalley.com/2014/05/27/swan/
(I am cutting down Himalayan Balsam with a scythe)

Himalayan Balsam
https://thesecretvalley.com/2012/05/09/himalayan-bolsom/

Japanese knotweed
https://thesecretvalley.com/2012/08/09/clearing-and-burning-the-japanese-knotweed/

attributes.action: Require the Government to immediately abolish tuition fees.
attributes.background: The current rate of interest charged by the Student Loan Company is currently eight times the current rate of inflation. Quite simply, the status quo will stifle this country's future prosperity by strangling our talent at birth.

attributes.action: Apply diplomatic pressure to both Norway and Japan to cease killing Whales.
attributes.background: Norway kills around 500 Minke Whales annually and Japan continues to defy International agreements citing scientific research as an excuse to hunt and kill whales. The most efficient killing methods leave about 20% of whales alive after the first strike, allowing untold agony and lingering death.

attributes.action: Stop calling the new minimum wage the 'National Living Wage'.
attributes.background: The Living Wage Foundation defines the living wage as £8.25 per hour for the UK as a whole, or £9.40 in London.  While we are glad that the minimum wage has been increased to £7.20, this is not the living wage.  As such, it should be called the Minimum Wage, NOT the 'National Living Wage'.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate: "It's wrong for UK to remain in democratic deficient EU."
attributes.background: Given that the UK has a centuries long tradition of democratic checks and balances and the EU has severe and structural democratic deficiencies it would be wrong for the UK to remain in the EU as to remain in the EU reduces the democratic means of accountability to the British People:
attributes.additional_details:
The key severe democratic deficiencies of the EU are as follows:

The EU has Four Presidents and NON are Elected
The EU Parliament CANNOT start new or get rid of existing EU Laws nor allow for Private Members or Private Bills
The EU Government (the EU Commission) is NOT Elected is not accountable to us & we CANNOT remove/change it
The EU does not form law in PUBLIC and does not enable people to take part in forming it or accountable public debate on EU law
The EU IS  DEMOCRATICALLY DEFICIENT

attributes.action: Make access to mains gas a legal right for all homes and properties in the UK.
attributes.background: Many families can't access mains gas & are forced to use more expensive forms of fuel for cooking and heating. The gas network often expands when new homes are built close to the existing network, however whole communities have been left behind because they are off grid, often only by a few miles.
attributes.additional_details: Mains gas delivered via a pipeline would instantly remove the damage to the environment caused by the hundreds of millions of carbon related miles from delivery trucks polluting our towns and villages each and every year whilst travelling back and forth delivering alternative expensive fuels such as LPG and oil to off grid homes. These journeys will never stop, there is no alternative. Over 1 million properties many with children and older occupants have no access to mains gas. Thats just wrong.

attributes.action: Pedestrian crossings by all schools
attributes.background: 2incidents have happened at my daughters school recently, I have wrote to local council to ask about a pedestrian crossing and their response was until there is a fatality, the answer is no! This IS DISGRACEFUL. I petition for crossings for all parents to get their children to school safely.

attributes.action: UK public to be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.background: The UK public elect its most influential people, Prime Minister, Chancellor, Home Secretary, Lord Mayor etc as a democracy. The UK public should also be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.additional_details: The Governor of the Bank of England directly has control over the UK debt, availability of homes, interest rates. The governor also needs to have measurable objectives that his performance can be directly assessed.

attributes.action: Prevent the exclusion of primary school children due to their haircuts.
attributes.background: A Birmingham primary school pupil was suspended from his school because his haircut 'wasn't suitable for their school policy' despite looking very smart. If a child has a smart, socially acceptable haircut, they should be allowed to wear it without harassment from their school.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-birmingham-36269041

attributes.action: Regulate and reduce hospital car parking charges.
attributes.background: My son was admitted to Gloucester Royal and on every visit we had no choice but to use their car parks.  On one occasion we parked at 15.08 and left at 16.10 and were charged 2 hours and there was no allowance for any "time" to get your ticket and vacate the car park.

attributes.action: Select the Taxpayers Alliance to oversee Parliamentary expenses
attributes.background: As we know IPSA has not had a good record in cracking down on fraud in the Houses of Commons and Lords many time we see the political elite getting away with expenses that ordinary people have to pay for in everyday life.
attributes.additional_details: Expenses should only be for paying staff, Office equipment, and in some cases travel not for paying off mortgages on second homes, meals, etc

attributes.action: Change the tax system so student loan repayments are taken before income tax.
attributes.background: Most students can not use their income tax allowance whilst studying at university and rely on borrowing money from the students loan company to cover living expenses. Therefore, repayments of this student debt should be exempt from income tax.
attributes.additional_details:
These changes would bring the following benefits:

1. Earlier repayment and reduced pressure of student debt
2. A fairer systems for those starting out in life
3. Additional encouragement for further education

attributes.action: Call on the European Parliament to urge MEPs to engage with constituents
attributes.background: Every four years, EU citizens vote on democratic representatives in the European Parliament (MEPs). Very few people know who their MEP is. If the UK votes to stay in the European Union, the Government must call on the European Parliament to urge MEPs to be more accessible and open to constituents.
attributes.additional_details: Various surveys showing how much people in the UK know about their MEP http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2014/may/10/voters-cant-name-their-mep http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/hands-up-if-you-know-who-your-mep-is-8679242.html

attributes.action: Change the title of the Ministry of Defence to the Ministry of Attack
attributes.background: I believe the current title is misleading and the proposed title is much more appropriate given the general nature of it's business.
attributes.additional_details:
The Ministry Of Defence was formally established in 1964, since which time it has overseen 12 military engagements. Out of these 12, UK borders have been threatened on only 2 occasions at most (The Falklands War and The Troubles). On the remaining 10 occasions, the Armed Forces were operating within another nations borders. 

The Oxford dictionary defines 'attack' as: 

(verb)

Take aggressive military action against (a place or enemy forces) with weapons or armed force.

attributes.action: Legalise the sale,possession and consumption of hash heesh.
attributes.background: The consumption and classification of hash heesh seem to be less contentious than the questions over weed. Discuss any remaining obstructions to the legalisation of hash.

attributes.action: Legalise muskets, cannons and swords for self defence
attributes.background: Similar to the second amendment in the US, muskets, swords and cannons can be possessed if a relevant licence is held (level 1 for a sword, level 2 for a musket and 3 for a cannon)the weapons cannot be concealed.Also create a body to monitor gun owners and distribute licences.

attributes.action: NHS to employ more Psychiatrists so patients are able to have a proper diagnosis
attributes.background: How is someone able to get better without a proper diagnosis? I believe if I had been diagnosed earlier then I would be now employed and become a productive member of society.
attributes.additional_details:
My doctor and I have continually requested a consultation with the NHS for an assessment with a psychiatrist for a duration of three years.  
The government is committed to mental health care mainly targeting dementia and teenagers.  What I propose covers everyone, all genders, races and financial backgrounds.  
The treatment I have received had really upset me and frustrated my GP, friends and family who are also affected by the condition I have. Everyone should have the right to a proper diagnosis and so the required treatment can be undertaken.

attributes.action: Change Immigration rules for non eu partners.
attributes.background:
Get rid of the financial requirements so that non eu partners can able to stay and work in the uk.
The only requirements need to be married or have a family with british national.
However, both of them can not claim any benefits or funds for 2 years.
attributes.additional_details:
I am british and married with japanese national.  My spouse can not stay and work in the uk because we can not  meet financial requirements. 
It's very unfair system for british national with non eu partners.

attributes.action: Allow freedom of movement to continue within the tech sector
attributes.background: The UK has a skills shortage when it comes to tech, and in order for us to remain the digital capital of Europe. We must allow talent to come easily into the UK. A complicated visa process will mean that talent goes elsewhere and we suffer as a result of it.

attributes.action: Agree to a second referendum on Scottish Independence
attributes.background: The actions of the UK government after the Brexit vote do not align with the people of Scotland. We are not bigoted. We are not racist. We welcome everybody based on their contribution, not on where they come from. The UK government does not behave in this way and so we must LEAVE.

attributes.action: Give retired police officers the authority to charge drivers using mobile phone
attributes.background: I spoke about this to a retired police inspector who thought it was a good idea , maybe they could get a part of the fine for there time taken to charge the person with the offence

attributes.action: Create mandatory recycling waste legislation in England
attributes.background: In Scotland - the regulations brought in, in January 2014, require all businesses and organisations to separate key materials – plastic, glass, metals, paper and card – for recycling, while most food businesses are also required to separate food waste for collection.
attributes.additional_details:
- See more at: http://www.zerowastescotland.org.uk/content/meeting-regulations-legislation#sthash.tem8wOF6.dpuf

The government needs to catch up with other, more forward thinking and environmentally aware countries to legislate on waste recycling as a matter or extreme urgency, to prevent the needless, toxic pollution of our earth, on which, all humans depend for their existence!

attributes.action: Stop the Government ripoff on car road tax transfer return to old system
attributes.background: when a car is sold in the middle of the month the owner losses two weeks road tax refund and the new owner has to pay from the beginning of the month  paying for two weeks he/she has not had,so the GOV.is stealing four weeks road tax, return to the old system where the road tax can stay with the car

attributes.action: Monday November 12 2018  be a UK  National Public Holiday to mark the end of WW1
attributes.background: During the past four years the Gov and the UK have been commemorating many events associated with the First World War - now as we near the 100th anniversary of its end , make the Monday nearest to Remembrance Day a National Holiday for people to reflect on the conflict that had just eneded

attributes.action: Allow MOD personnel to cook meals within SLA using issued or personal appliances
attributes.background: Safety regulations have resulted in the banning of any cooking appliances other than microwave and toaster within SLA. This makes PAYD the only option on camps for eating a hot meal, allowing for monopoly by contractors. Personnel should be allowed the option of cooking their own meals if they wish.

attributes.action: Hold a parliamentary debate on the re-introduction of selective State Education
attributes.background: The Government has announced the return of selection in Secondary Education in England without any manifesto commitment or mandate to do so and 40 years after it was abolished as socially divisive and intrinsically unfair to the economically less advantaged.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister argues that the re-introduction of grammar schools will enhance social mobility. However the evidence on the ground in those few areas where selective education remains entrenched is that though it may do so for the lucky few, many more are left behind. Selection favours affluent families who pay for the extra coaching to pass the selection tests and obstructs access for the poorest.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of tobacco products in the UK
attributes.background: Tobacco products such as cigarettes kill 100,000 people around the  the UK in one year. It also harms many other people through second hand smoking. The life expectancy of a smoker is about 10 years less than a non smoker. Wouldn't it save many more lives if you banned the sale of tobacco products?
attributes.additional_details: http://patient.info/health/smoking-the-facts

attributes.action: Make legal, individual to be in possession and smoke small quantity of cannabis
attributes.background: Cannabis is an illegal drug throughout the UK, although there may be scientific evidence to prove that it may be harmful but isn't it an individual's right to make that decision whether is be harmful to themselves or not. It should be legal for small quantity but not enough for distribution
attributes.additional_details: It provides medical benefits that some prescription drugs cannot

attributes.action: Return the railways to full state control and ownership
attributes.background:
High prices, rotten service on our trains..Let get our railways back to full state ownership so profits benefit train users not shareholders..
Each private contract ends so it can be taken over by the state. No big buyouts needed..

attributes.action: Increase the restriction speed for 50cc mopeds to 60mph
attributes.background: I use 60mph roads on a regular basis. I have found that other road users grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass at dangerous points of which could easily result in a threat on my life as some cars overtake and narrowly avoid a head on crash
attributes.additional_details: I have been riding my 50cc motorbike for a few months now and I have to use 60mph/40mph roads on a regular basis on my way to school. I have found that other road users in larger vehicles grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass on corners and/or dangerously close to me. There have also been some that risk a head on crash in an attempt to pass. A faster speed in my eyes would eliminate the threat that other road users oppose to slower mopeds.

attributes.action: National vote to Legalise right to die
attributes.background:
Let there be a nationwide referendum to vote for the right to die,
In extreme circumstances A person should have the right to choose to legally and safely end their life

attributes.action: Legalise the age of buying and smoking e-juice to 14 with parental consent
attributes.background: Vaping and smoking e-juices do not harm kids! I'm 14 years old and I stopped smoking and moved onto e-juice. This is much less harmful then cigarettes and maybe more kids might stop smoking if the legal age was dropped.

attributes.action: Reduce APD to bring it in line with other European countries.
attributes.background: For too long the UK has paid extortionate taxes on air travel - far higher than other countries. Reduce APD so that people can afford their well earned holidays.

attributes.action: Declare a national day of mourning when David Attenborough dies.
attributes.background: All non-essential services stop (most offices, shops etc) in order for all to stay home and watch his programmes.

attributes.action: Make inheritance tax applicable to all estates without exception.
attributes.background: It appears very rich people can avoid paying inheritance tax by using tax avoidance measures such as trusts. It would be fair if tax laws were simple and applied to everyone. If it is the law that inheritance tax is paid on estates above a certain value it must apply to everyone without exception.

attributes.action: Changes to the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991.
attributes.background: Many dogs that are confiscated are done so because they look dangerous or because of their breed specification; Pit Bull Terrier, Staffordshire Bull Terrier, I believe that they should only be destroyed if they commit an act that deems them dangerous (full on attack on a child or vulnerable person)
attributes.additional_details: What I believe should happen is that when a dog commits a crime such as attacking a child they are to be put on a 2 stage warning system, the dog is then taken for an behaviour assessment and the owners property is assessed for welfare standards. If the dog then commits the act again more serious action can be taken to change the behaviour such as rehousing the dog to a different family to see if the dog with change then if this option has failed then the dog can be destroyed.

attributes.action: make naloxone available to all opiate / opioid users in the uk.
attributes.background: I myself have almost lost my life to opiate overdoses and I have lost friends to opiate overdoses. lets do our best to stop this. This drug has absolutely no effect on people without opiates / opioids in their system.
attributes.additional_details: Naloxone is a medication used to counter the effects of opioid overdose Specifically, naloxone is used in opioid overdoses to counteract life-threatening depression of the central nervous system and respiratory system, allowing an overdose victim to breathe normally. Naloxone only works if a person has opioids in their system; the medication has no effect if opioids are absent. Naloxone has no potential for abuse.  It is a temporary drug that wears off in 20-90 minutes. (harmreduction.org)

attributes.action: Introduce independent life skills In schools
attributes.background: We are a campaign called Lessons4Life, we are raising awareness that young people aren't being taught in school how to deal with real life situations (such as changing a fuse) We need your help to make a change !
attributes.additional_details: We carried out a survey which revealed that 93% of participants did not understand what a mortgage was. One survey participant stated ‘We aren’t taught these skills at all. I am about to go into year 10 and I have no clue how to pay tax or mortgage.’ This supports our campaign proposal and highlights that this issue needs to be made aware and eventually resolved.

attributes.action: Restore the Imperial system of measurment to the UK and phase out Metrication.
attributes.background: Metrication was forced upon the UK as a result of joining the so called EEC with those that resisted being prosecuted. Now that we are about to become a sovereign nation again and resume trade with many commonwealth and former colonies we need to return to what is a superior standard of measurement.

attributes.action: Register Endometriosis As a Disability
attributes.background: Hello My name is Selina-Louise and I Suffer With a Condition Called Endometriosis its a life changing condition which is extremely painful , it's where the lining of the uterus grows outside and can spread to the bowls and even lungs there is no cure.
attributes.additional_details: It should be a known condition and defiantly should be registered as a disability it's incredibly painful and has left some women infertile
